rule.name: G-0000: Avoid using the NOSONAR marker.
G-9001: Always prefix global variables with 'g_'.
rule.description:
Reason

To easily distinguish between global and local variables.

Furthermore, the use of a prefix avoids naming conflicts with reserved words.

Bad

create or replace package pkg as
   global_variable integer;
end pkg;
/

Good

create or replace package pkg as
   g_global_variable integer;
end pkg;
/

rule.name: G-9002: Always prefix local variables with 'l_'.
rule.description:
Reason

To easily distinguish between global and local variables.

Furthermore, the use of a prefix avoids naming conflicts with reserved words.

Bad

create or replace procedure p as
   c integer;
begin
   null;
end p;
/

Good

create or replace procedure p as
   l_something integer;
begin
   null;
end p;
/

rule.name: G-9003: Always prefix parameters with 'p_'.
rule.description:
Reason

To easily distinguish between parameters and variables.

Furthermore, the use of a prefix avoids naming conflicts with reserved words.

Bad

create or replace procedure p (a in integer, b in varchar2) as
begin
   null;
end p;
/

Good

create or replace procedure p (p_1 in integer, p_2 in varchar2) as
begin
   null;
end p;
/

rule.name: E-0001: Timeout occurred (after n seconds) during load/parse/validation of resource.
rule.description:
Reason

Processing large SQL files takes time. Increase the db* CODECOP timeout parameter to avoid this error. The default timeout per file is 10 seconds.

rule.name: E-0002: Syntax error. Please contact the author if the code compiles successfully in your environment.
rule.description:
Reason

It's either a db* CODECOP bug or a limitation, if the code compiles successfully in your environment.

Please note, that syntax errors may lead to false positives. db* CODECOP will therefore not report guideline violations, if a syntax error was encountered in the processed file.

rule.name: E-0003: License limit reached.
rule.description:
Reason

A db* CODECOP license key defines limitations for the number of files, lines, commands and bytes to be processed. Please contact your Trivadis representative to obtain a less restrictive license.
